messages.content:
Can you help extract all the projects from the notes docs from the various tables below and create a table of the projects that they want to do in the future. Cluster the projects that are similar and add a column for the tables that mention similar projects:

First notes:

Circle: Table 1A - 2nd Unconferencing

Time: 00:00 AM

Topic: Write here..

Leader: Name

Note taker: Bilal

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Notes:

Deepti

I was a part of two groups: We are a movement who want wellbeing at the core of all organizations, and for right now all higher education.

As a vision, we reach out to more organizations. Collaborate.

More stakeholders, more ideas / answers.

Bilal: Schools are interesting spaces to influence ideas

Lots of ambiguity about what it is we are really doing. What do we really take back?

Laughter/hug doesn’t count.

Wellbeing at the core of higher education institutions

And wellbeing is a very “heavy subject” - We want the orgs to be lean

Safe space.

T 3 groups:

Focused on central mission / who are we?

This network is by higher education network and for higher education

By them and for htem. Includes all higher education ecosystem to create global connections that help us embody wellbeing and foster welldoing.

Other groups discussed seeds who we are.

Recalling the history of universities as places of “Formation” not a

Wellbeing fits in both places. Beyond in higher education.

Central mission to facilitate collaborations?

Bringing a wellbeing curriculum into all different departments.

How do cope with stressors at school - bringing the

H2 Horizon two

Set up an exchange program to learn first hand how peoples organizations work and bring wellbeing work or don’t work.

Student immersion - exchanging students. Exchanging context of a person it’s a lot wider of a perspective.

Yallah beirut.

More people from our organizations involved from this. I got permission from vice president, they know that I’m here. I wish I could take something fromhere to convince top level management that this matters. Deepti - says Same! I’m the only indian person here. Why not make a smaller hub in India itself. Regional meetups. We’re smaller.

Many big organizations are focused on Wellbeing.

How do you work on

Wellbeing practices you’re doing this year. Make it real for us first.

Maybe we have accountability buddies?

Superna models these kinds of things. That kind of modeling helps us see that wellbeing practices can be done.

Getting more personal - accountability and followup meetings.

Personal/communal wellbeing can be practiced together.

To work on systemic/structural action - we share policies for wellbeing / code of conduct. Organizational change / processes and procedures.

Round 2:

Sleepy - no cognitive dissonance

Values and exploration of values.

Accountability buddies

Focus on my own wellbeing first is challenging

Focus is always impact oriented first not inclined to focus myself

Mapping of people resources knowledge in the room

Access them as people, not as a DB/ to upload papers

Trauma informed curriculum for youth - how can I search DB with certain keywords to find the right people who can help me do that.

Coming up with new tech platforms isn’t always so useful. It’s all about relationships. Tech platform that helps connect humans. Knowledge exchange.

Human conversation helps accelerate knowledge transfer.

Osare:

Next year get down to the basics as a network. If you asked everyone what’s the point. We will all give you a general idea but not give you a specific idea.

Clear articulation of what’s going on, why, where, what are we solving for. (maybe how later)

Based on direction - co-woning and codirection. Not ready for that yet. Some form of leadership. Someone who has authority of direction. Someone who says ‘this is the point, this is direction” - based on that we make a year plan.

When a person comes in after that establishment - people can start working because there is a structure.

General need: curriculum. Design session.

Codesigning curriculum then coming back and contextualizing.

Knowledge sharing: It’s now the job of each member to contextualize. This is what we designed/contextualized and share.

Everyone is beautiful and nice and food is good…. What’s happening?

Q. Do we need specific goals for the network? Do we need to set specific goals for the network?

Concern is to add work on top of our work. Set a different work plan w/different goals / priorities would people do it?

O: Goal number 1, who is leadership/authority of direction. Articulate that and disseminate.

We were working in groups but largely unproductive because we were not directed.

Work we’re doing already based on a direction that’s already been set.

Intentionally setting results and deliverables then it could work

Bahare:

I’m so sleepy.

I didn’t get to talk to everyone here and there are more people who are not here.

Make the community and give us more instruction and framework to do our own parts in it.

Elisa:

DB to filter and search who might be interesting to talk to a mandatory spotlight on who they are and a challenge they are facing.

See the projects people are working on.

Bilal

If you liked someone call them.

Doughnut put availability and schedule chats with people

Onboarding - easier when there is clarity.

Foster engagement, subcircles, regional events.

Banking of talents.

Estefania - nature growth? Facilitation guide for wellbeing ambassadors.

Identify existing wellbeing definitions for higher education institutions.

Resonate w/xy or z

Working groups, call to clarify purpose. Overarching purpose. Set expectations and milestones.

Mapping what we have - not constructing new things. Pep already has working group.

Leave here with something we are interested in developing with other members.

What’s working / not working .

Choosing the right technology.

Notion could be applied for everyone.

Spotlight moments.

Working group presentations.

Action Steps:

Write here..

Second set of notes:

Circle: 3A

Time: 00:00 AM

Topic: Horizon 2 – What will we do in the year ahead

Leader: Name

Note taker: Kaisu

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Notes:

Topics, structures topics that help us to move from Horizon 1 to Horizon 2. Generating specific ideas.

A little bit more structure and guidance would help a lot. Towards where are we heading?

If we have ideas to share ideas to implement in wellbeing curriculum, which is the platform to enable collaboration. Open, visible, easy to use.

An element of leadership is needed to be strengthened.

It is useful to have the conversation of what people want to turnh that to clear actions.

What is the prelog of the network? Would be nice to know the narrative from the past to build the narrative of the future.

For instance in this gathering everything that has been done has been enjoyable but sometimes missing which are the bigger purposes of things.

We need to get down to the basics; articulating the point of the network, to be able to figure out what are our goals. We could have a better onboarding plan.

If you ask people what this network is about they may be related but there are many definitions.

Disciplinary or interdisciplinary outcomes of what we want to have

Ideas from others and see how to apply in ones own different context

Once having clear goals we can also measure wins and losses and share them, learn from them.

Knowing the end goal is critical to know how to build the path.

For new members or the ones that did not necessary drive their participation in the network its not being clear on how to see or build a clear direction. Need of understanding which is the framework/playground.

How could we reach into a stonger leadership model to show direction.

How could we come up with a blueprint for our process.

To have a resource of what people have been doing and showcase – receive feedback, other ideas.

Ability to connect more and more on an individual level outside of the encounterings and forums. Projects or working groups but also ways to connect in an individual level.

It may be also a reflection of the network that the

Past – small amout of institutions coming together, putting their blueprints together, editorial work of what this network may mean. Suddenly a huge growth in the network – somehow seeing what each one does and who we really are. The workgroups were built – documentation, barriors to wellbeing (commonalities and barriers), curriculum group broke up into multiple subgroups – building curriculum wide spectrum; specific to wellbeing, community; divided in to students faculty and different schools trying to find funding together. After all that we took the first day to see what was good on looking into the working groups, stage two where are we now and where do we want to head, and now trying to see what can be needed in concrete to take the next steps.

Best practises and/or renaissance in higher ed with wellbeing at the core; how could we help each other to get that by convincing policy makers, presidents and funding…

90 members, different levels of participation; we have 2 years to get ourselves on the track, that is the time that Wellbeing is sustaining much of the coordination.

How can this serve everyone in a way that is important.

Action Steps:

Building a clear vision and goals → robust plan of involvement

Sharing best practises and seeing the best way to do so – Monthly conversations and themes to work on, or dividing based on projects. This requires more organizational ledership

Goals that unite, even if there can be different priorities.

Onboarding plan – clarity in what is going on and how can you be part and take advantage of it

Focus and dynamics

Commonalities and working areas to work on

Directory of people their interests and their willing to be contacted for….

Third set of notes:

Circle: 8A

Time: 00:00 AM

Topic: Horizon 2 - What will we do in the year ahead?

Leader: Name

Note taker: Name

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Note:

Can the definition of well-being be shared among institutions or does it depend a lot on institutions’ context?

Action steps:

Write here..

Mapping projects

Themes

Methodologies

Target / Stakeholder definition

Improving communication

Choose the right technological tools

i. Notion

Continue doing spotlight moments

Include “Case clinics” – present challenges we are facing; share challenges and what went wrong (fail fest) – present context, challenge, implementation, results

Working groups presentations – pitch moment for current and new projects.

Include accountability (milestones and present results)

Support the work that the members are already doing

Support each other leveraging the work in each others institutions (e.g. convincing leadership)

Network should help make the case – produce materials with data / impact that can be shown to the partner institution leadership

Support schools in restructure education in a way that opromotes social and emotional developmeny

Structural changes are needed

The education model has to improve

What is social change? It’s not so clear

Library:

Share the partners definitions of well-being

Institutional presentations about the well-being project and what it is doing

Research/publications (by topic)

Study cases

Courses

Programs (

…

Fourth set of notes:

Circle: 6A

Time: 00:00 AM

Topic: What projects should we focus on as a network?

Leader: Name

Note taker: Ed Stevenette

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Notes/Possible projects:

Round 1

Project to Map the assets of members in the network => skills workshop or questionnaire to map skills / expertise / tools of members in the network to avoid duplication, maximise our efforts, and shape projects based on these assets

E.g. LearningPlanet projects and events platforms were developed over many years due to needing spaces to key track of the initiatives / resources / events in communities, adapted to needs of social impact networks and institutions. Could be used by the Wellbeing network. Also experience on crowdsourcing resources / funders / policy connected to a topic : example of the gallery here.

Project to design holistic Wellbeing strategy to guide institutions

\- Guidance to build the holistic strategy to improve the wellbeing in the university. E.g. Whole University Approach (has been used in the UK, early days, could be interesting to adapt this to the needs of the global education community)

\- How to impact the strategies of Director generals to bring wellbeing at the center. Elaborating the concept of holistic wellbeing so it is not just ‘another service’.

Project to help students to discover and develop their vocation as a network =>

E.g. Ikigai+ working group (Pep, Pascal, Claire…)

Project to create regional immersion programmes e.g. members spending ¾ days at Koc University, or Oxford, or LPI… Could make this regionally focused (e.g. 3 to 4 local institutions coming together), or available for the whole network. Maximising the benefits of place-based, and feeding this into the weaving of the network. Creating a goal of some output of these exchanges.

Project to document tools => If we (the network) were to die in 5 years, what are we leaving behind for the good of the planet?

\- Resources, project examples, toolkits. To make ourselves accountable to leave behind value for the world even when we might not be here in our current form

Example here from AIME mentoring of why they have created a ‘death strategy’ : https://aimementoring.com/2023/01/20/the-aime-intentional-death-strategy/

Project : interactive newsletter to share offers / needs

https://superhive.is/

Project to create Wellbeing certification/labelling? E.g. B-Corp for wellbeing

\- Case making for institutions to become ‘Wellbeing institutions’

\- example : Okanagan charter : https://wellbeing.ubc.ca/okanagan-charter . Focused on wellbeing within policy. Our charter could be commitment to inner development of individuals/communities?

\- Could be done in 3 days! e.g. ‘ In June 2015, UBC co-hosted the International Conference on Health Promoting Universities and Colleges at the Okanagan campus, bringing together participants from 45 countries, representing both educational institutions and health organizations, including the World Health Organization and UNESCO. Over three days, these organizations collaborated on the development of the Okanagan Charter: An International Charter for Health Promoting Universities and Colleges.’

Project to share the stories and challenges institutions face in becoming wellbeing institutions

E.g. Said Business School : one indicator for going high in uni rankings is salary of students post-graduation. Leads to those championing the corporate futures getting high up. Issue in the system. Important these stories are shared.

Write here..

Round 2

+2 for project for easy documentation of projects / tools / knowledge/ expertise, and making it easy to sift through this info based on needs. Can be also a way of building inner communities based on whoever has shared needs/projects>

\- ‘Marketing to everyone is marketing to no-one’ => Get a group of people together with a shared interest. Building from there.

+1 for project building the Wellbeing project network definition of wellbeing / criteria and or core values to unite the way we do things.

+1 for project sharing case studies of the local realities (makes the case for setting up regional collaborations / immersions)

+1 for project to reflect on responsibility to know what we are leaving behind for future ‘generations’

NEW : Project to make / connect groupings in the network based on similar backgrounds. Making sure these people discuss/collaborate as priority, and that then weaving can occur across these audience.

3 groupings seem to exist in the wellbeing project. Setting up specific working sessions between members of these different groups.

1\. Pioneering institutions

Those who are already living and breathing wellbeing.

E.g. Mondragon University

2\. Faculty in established institutions

Those advocating / running wellbeing projects/programmes/research within large institutions

E.g. Member of Harvard, Stanford

3\. The network / community builders / social entrepeneurs

Those advocating / connecting / leveraging wellbeing projects in the social impact space e.g. LearningPlanet

Action Steps:

Write here..

Fifth set of notes:

Circle: 2A

Time: 00:00 AM

Topic: Horizon 2 brainstorming

Leader: Name

Note taker: DMN

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Session 1: Estefania, Lene, Pascale, Yanniz, DMN

Session 2: Claire, Thais, Ilke, DMN

Notes:

Have a shared calendar (potentially on Notion) to add events so everyone is aware what’s happening

Potentially combined with

Superhive … monthly newsletter, interactive … help people become more aware about what’s upcoming, what people are working on, etc.

Who: Lead: Pascal (using it in Sandbox)

What: An auto-generated / supported tool to help improve communications in a regular basis.

When:

Introducing it to Ale+Silvana in coming two weeks

More frequent regional gatherings … come together more locally, more often

MENA

What: … potentially align with World with Purpose conf

Who:

When:

Have exchanges between institutions … of trainers / faculty / students / shadowing / mentoring

What:

More visits … with a particular output for a visit.

Have a simple list of institutions, what they need, what they can offer, etc

Who:

Leaders:

Thais can help with the organization mapping

Contributors:

Claire

Ilke: Setting up a makerspace … Bilal can go hang out and do stuff there

When:

Wellbeing Homes Network - who is open to hosting others?

More collaborative projects

“Friendship based social change”

PERMAH Revision Collaborative Project

Who:

Leader: DMN/Bloom (open to co-leads); who’s interested in joining?

Members: Thais

What: Have a revised PERMAH that takes into account other things missing, issues in developing countries/marginalized communities, etc.

When:

Align on first meeting in coming two weeks

First revision in a month

Two months of internal testing

One month for revisions

Share with Higher Ed network for additional feedback / testing

Publish results! :-)

Building the Pool of Wellbeing Facilitators in the World (Meta-project & sub-projects)

Who:

Leaders: Estefania, DMN, Pascal, Lene

Contributors: Claire

What:

Professionalize

Deprofessionalize … make much more accessible … strengthen the pool of global wellbeing facilitators

Develop/identify set of “generalized facilitation capacities” … support to develop them

Build towards certification levels, programs, etc … “open source certification” … where the certifiers need to first be certified. Fractal open approach.

When:

Estefania will compile key elements into kumu.io to share within two weeks … first with working group, then with Ale and Silvana c

Create a guide or guides

Basic intro guide … beginning / middle / end

Icebreakers

… use your body … use your mind …

Identify capacities of facilitators, framework

(kumu.io)

Develop list of resources

Topics

Reiki

Ikigai

Self-massage

Aromatherapy

Meditation

Yoga

Sound healing

Gratitude

Hexaflex

Acceptance & commitment therapy

Skills map for facilitation

Resonance facilitation

List of different offerings … and people who can lead them … and include as introductory sessions

Fundraising / Proposal writing

Who: DMN, …

What:

When:

Have improved resource library

Compilation of available resources … compiling public tools, creating some of our own

Lene can help

Could we get shared access to some digital library tools of some bigger organizations / institutions?

“Public library” for restricted resources (we have the Bloom Library on Libby, but other orgs have access to much bigger libraries)

Wellbeing Care for the Carers

Accountability buddies

Framework for checkins

Trauma response

Who:

Leaders:

Contributor: Ayse, DMN

What:

Trauma-informed research, practices, etc

When:

Action Steps:

Write here..

Sixth state of notes:

Circle: 5A

Time: 00:00 AM

Topic: Horizon 2 sharing of ideas

Leader: Name

Note taker: Name: Deborah Donahue-Keegan

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Notes: Ana Celia,

Part of the mission of the program: take care of the changemakers - share wellbeing practices with those around us. Build momentum – a movement

Advocate for formalized wellbeing programs in higher education institutions

Lacking a strategic plan - need to generate umbrella priorities – with specific projects

Develop skills to manage projects in different group - timelines, identify clear indicators - then reflect, shift for iterative process.

Structure for documentation

Need a clear definition of well-being – an umbrella (universal?) definition / framework that can be translated, adapted in the range of institutional contexts. Should members of the network review Dr. Richard Davidson’s 4 Pillars of Wellbeing: Awareness, Connection, Insight, Purpose – as a starting point

Common curated research hub – building research (pilot studies, collaborative research between universities)

Hub for wellbeing in higher ed projects - template for institutions to complete (info about mission, objectives, etc.)

Establish an online platform for social connecting, peer learning/inquiry, mentoring, research, projects - for cross-pollination

Directory with members’ respective areas of expertise

During the year, have meetings with step-back consultation - about dilemma re: wellbeing in higher education - one person presents a dilemma, then “steps back” to listen as the group discusses the dilemma, ways to address via wellbeing framework, etc.

Working groups need a reboot - restructuring, protocol, with timeline, goals,

Community of practice - library of resources (videos, etc.) - on a platform - to help us have more voice and sense of agency - shift in mindset

Identify and develop collaboration possibilities across/between institutions

North star, values, strategic planning (manual, templates, etc.) - more clearly define re: wellbeing in higher education

Action Steps:

Write here..

If we have ideas to share ideas to implement in wellbeing curriculum, which is the platform to enable collaboration. Open, visible, easy to use.

Ideas from others and see how to apply in ones own different context

After all that we took the first day to see what was good on looking into the working groups, stage two where are we now and where do we want to head, and now trying to see what can be needed in concrete to take the next steps.

90 members, different levels of participation; we have 2 years to get ourselves on the track, that is the time that Wellbeing is sustaining much of the coordination.

How can this serve everyone in a way that is important.

Action Steps:

Building a clear vision and goals → robust plan of involvement

Sharing best practises and seeing the best way to do so – Monthly conversations and themes to work on, or dividing based on projects. This requires more organizational ledership

Goals that unite, even if there can be different priorities.

Onboarding plan – clarity in what is going on and how can you be part and take advantage of it

Focus and dynamics

Commonalities and working areas to work on

Directory of people their interests and their willing to be contacted for….

Note:

Can the definition of well-being be shared among institutions or does it depend a lot on institutions’ context?

Action steps:

Themes

Methodologies

Target / Stakeholder definition

Improving communication

Choose the right technological tools

i. Notion

Continue doing spotlight moments

Include “Case clinics” – present challenges we are facing; share challenges and what went wrong (fail fest) – present context, challenge, implementation, results

Working groups presentations – pitch moment for current and new projects.

Include accountability (milestones and present results)

Support the work that the members are already doing

Support each other leveraging the work in each others institutions (e.g. convincing leadership)

Network should help make the case – produce materials with data / impact that can be shown to the partner institution leadership

Support schools in restructure education in a way that opromotes social and emotional developmeny

Structural changes are needed

The education model has to improve

What is social change? It’s not so clear

Library:

Share the partners definitions of well-being

Institutional presentations about the well-being project and what it is doing

Research/publications (by topic)

Study cases

Courses

Programs (

…

Fourth set of notes:

Circle: 6A

Time: 00:00 AM

Topic: What projects should we focus on as a network?

Leader: Name

Note taker: Ed Stevenette

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Notes/Possible projects:

Round 1

Project to Map the assets of members in the network => skills workshop or questionnaire to map skills / expertise / tools of members in the network to avoid duplication, maximise our efforts, and shape projects based on these assets

E.g. LearningPlanet projects and events platforms were developed over many years due to needing spaces to key track of the initiatives / resources / events in communities, adapted to needs of social impact networks and institutions. Could be used by the Wellbeing network. Also experience on crowdsourcing resources / funders / policy connected to a topic : example of the gallery here.

Project to design holistic Wellbeing strategy to guide institutions

\- Guidance to build the holistic strategy to improve the wellbeing in the university. E.g. Whole University Approach (has been used in the UK, early days, could be interesting to adapt this to the needs of the global education community)

\- How to impact the strategies of Director generals to bring wellbeing at the center. Elaborating the concept of holistic wellbeing so it is not just ‘another service’.

Project to help students to discover and develop their vocation as a network =>

E.g. Ikigai+ working group (Pep, Pascal, Claire…)

Project to create regional immersion programmes e.g. members spending ¾ days at Koc University, or Oxford, or LPI… Could make this regionally focused (e.g. 3 to 4 local institutions coming together), or available for the whole network. Maximising the benefits of place-based, and feeding this into the weaving of the network. Creating a goal of some output of these exchanges.

Project to document tools => If we (the network) were to die in 5 years, what are we leaving behind for the good of the planet?

\- Resources, project examples, toolkits. To make ourselves accountable to leave behind value for the world even when we might not be here in our current form

Example here from AIME mentoring of why they have created a ‘death strategy’ : https://aimementoring.com/2023/01/20/the-aime-intentional-death-strategy/

Project : interactive newsletter to share offers / needs

https://superhive.is/

Project to create Wellbeing certification/labelling? E.g. B-Corp for wellbeing

\- Case making for institutions to become ‘Wellbeing institutions’

\- example : Okanagan charter : https://wellbeing.ubc.ca/okanagan-charter . Focused on wellbeing within policy. Our charter could be commitment to inner development of individuals/communities?

\- Could be done in 3 days! e.g. ‘ In June 2015, UBC co-hosted the International Conference on Health Promoting Universities and Colleges at the Okanagan campus, bringing together participants from 45 countries, representing both educational institutions and health organizations, including the World Health Organization and UNESCO. Over three days, these organizations collaborated on the development of the Okanagan Charter: An International Charter for Health Promoting Universities and Colleges.’

Project to share the stories and challenges institutions face in becoming wellbeing institutions

E.g. Said Business School : one indicator for going high in uni rankings is salary of students post-graduation. Leads to those championing the corporate futures getting high up. Issue in the system. Important these stories are shared.

Write here..

Round 2

+2 for project for easy documentation of projects / tools / knowledge/ expertise, and making it easy to sift through this info based on needs. Can be also a way of building inner communities based on whoever has shared needs/projects>

\- ‘Marketing to everyone is marketing to no-one’ => Get a group of people together with a shared interest. Building from there.

+1 for project building the Wellbeing project network definition of wellbeing / criteria and or core values to unite the way we do things.

+1 for project sharing case studies of the local realities (makes the case for setting up regional collaborations / immersions)

+1 for project to reflect on responsibility to know what we are leaving behind for future ‘generations’

NEW : Project to make / connect groupings in the network based on similar backgrounds. Making sure these people discuss/collaborate as priority, and that then weaving can occur across these audience.

3 groupings seem to exist in the wellbeing project. Setting up specific working sessions between members of these different groups.

1\. Pioneering institutions

Those who are already living and breathing wellbeing.

E.g. Mondragon University

2\. Faculty in established institutions

Those advocating / running wellbeing projects/programmes/research within large institutions

E.g. Member of Harvard, Stanford

3\. The network / community builders / social entrepeneurs

Those advocating / connecting / leveraging wellbeing projects in the social impact space e.g. LearningPlanet

Action Steps:

Write here..

Building the Pool of Wellbeing Facilitators in the World (Meta-project & sub-projects)

Build towards certification levels, programs, etc … “open source certification” … where the certifiers need to first be certified. Fractal open approach.

Notes: Ana Celia,

Part of the mission of the program: take care of the changemakers - share wellbeing practices with those around us. Build momentum – a movement

Advocate for formalized wellbeing programs in higher education institutions

Lacking a strategic plan - need to generate umbrella priorities – with specific projects

Develop skills to manage projects in different group - timelines, identify clear indicators - then reflect, shift for iterative process.

Structure for documentation

Need a clear definition of well-being – an umbrella (universal?) definition / framework that can be translated, adapted in the range of institutional contexts. Should members of the network review Dr. Richard Davidson’s 4 Pillars of Wellbeing: Awareness, Connection, Insight, Purpose – as a starting point

Common curated research hub – building research (pilot studies, collaborative research between universities)

Hub for wellbeing in higher ed projects - template for institutions to complete (info about mission, objectives, etc.)

Establish an online platform for social connecting, peer learning/inquiry, mentoring, research, projects - for cross-pollination

Directory with members’ respective areas of expertise

During the year, have meetings with step-back consultation - about dilemma re: wellbeing in higher education - one person presents a dilemma, then “steps back” to listen as the group discusses the dilemma, ways to address via wellbeing framework, etc.

Working groups need a reboot - restructuring, protocol, with timeline, goals,

Community of practice - library of resources (videos, etc.) - on a platform - to help us have more voice and sense of agency - shift in mindset

Identify and develop collaboration possibilities across/between institutions

North star, values, strategic planning (manual, templates, etc.) - more clearly define re: wellbeing in higher education

Write here..

Identifying wellbeing definitions and frameworks for higher ed	Table 2A, 6A

Revisiting working groups 										   Table 5A
Developing collaboration between institutions 					   Table 5A

Focus on members’ wellbeing and self-care                             Table 1A, 2A

Documenting and sharing stories of  challenges of transitioning towellbeing institutions			Table 4A
